item.title: Unlimited energy!?!?
item.dc:creator: @xx_qwertyuiop_xx xx qwertyuiop xx
item.description:
@xx_qwertyuiop_xx wrote:

[quote=“Denoria, post:7, topic:273243”][quote author=xx qwertyuiop xx link=topic=360623.msg2748355#msg2748355 date=1239756350]

[quote author=Psycotix link=topic=360623.msg2747135#msg2747135 date=1239693743]

player.java

How?? what file? help omg…
[/quote]It would make us all happy, if you would stop posting this shit, qwerty.

Well it’s obvious enough.
The file is probably only about 1000 lines long (about 2/5 of those being variable declarations) and if he searched for a word related to what he was looking for, perhaps “energy”, he would have had it figured out in seconds.

already has,

str.writeBits(1, 0); if (playerEnergy > 0) { playerEnergy -= 1; } else { isRunning2 = false;

Read the code.
You don’t want to stop running, so remove isRunning2 = false.
Since you’re never going to stop running, you don’t even need energy, so you can remove the rest.
[/quote]Wow…just because your a pro coder you don’t have to be an idiot.

Edit: it says Energy Left:
1% or 15%, and at %1 you still have run so your infinity but, how do i make it say Unlimited instead of %1 or %16

So Eg:

Instead Of:

Energy Left
95%

Make it Say:

Energy Left:
Unlimited[/quote]
sendFrame126(“Unlimited”, 149);

You’re welcome.

Read full topic

Well it’s obvious enough.
The file is probably only about 1000 lines long (about 2/5 of those being variable declarations) and if he searched for a word related to what he was looking for, perhaps “energy”, he would have had it figured out in seconds.

already has,

str.writeBits(1, 0); if (playerEnergy > 0) { playerEnergy -= 1; } else { isRunning2 = false;

Read the code.
You don’t want to stop running, so remove isRunning2 = false.
Since you’re never going to stop running, you don’t even need energy, so you can remove the rest.[/quote]Wow…just because your a pro coder you don’t have to be an idiot.

Edit: it says Energy Left:
1% or 15%, and at %1 you still have run so your infinity but, how do i make it say Unlimited instead of %1 or %16

95%

item.title: Unlimited energy!?!?
item.dc:creator: @xx_qwertyuiop_xx xx qwertyuiop xx
item.description:
@xx_qwertyuiop_xx wrote:

[quote=“Psycotix, post:3, topic:273243”][quote author=xx qwertyuiop xx link=topic=360623.msg2747109#msg2747109 date=1239689559]
player.java
[/quote]

[quote author=Denoria link=topic=360623.msg2747108#msg2747108 date=1239689444]
How?? what file? help omg…
[/quote]It would make us all happy, if you would stop posting this shit, qwerty.[/quote]
Well it’s obvious enough.
The file is probably only about 1000 lines long (about 2/5 of those being variable declarations) and if he searched for a word related to what he was looking for, perhaps “energy”, he would have had it figured out in seconds.

[quote=“Denoria, post:5, topic:273243”]already has,

str.writeBits(1, 0); if (playerEnergy > 0) { playerEnergy -= 1; } else { isRunning2 = false;[/quote]
Read the code.
You don’t want to stop running, so remove isRunning2 = false.
Since you’re never going to stop running, you don’t even need energy, so you can remove the rest.
